summary: The Rolling Stones are an English rock band formed in 1962, known for their hard rock sound and enduring popularity. Originally led by Brian Jones, the band found greater success when Mick Jagger and Keith Richards started writing their own songs. They were part of the British Invasion in the 1960s and had big hits like "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction" and "Paint It Black." After Jones left, Mick Taylor and later Ronnie Wood joined. The band has sold over 250 million records, won three Grammy Awards, and been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. They continue to perform and release music, with their latest album, "Hackney Diamonds," released in 2023.
title: The Rolling Stones
